Speaker: stagehand
Dialogue: Where'd you think you're going?!

Speaker: bearded man
Dialogue: I'm part of the act, you fool!

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Who was that?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Because of course, you're not really looking...

Speaker: prosecutor
Dialogue: And did Robert Angier, the Great Danton, your employer, get to that final part of his trick that night?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: No, sir. Something went wrong.

Speaker: prosecutor
Dialogue: What went wrong?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I saw a someone head below the stage... I followed... and I found  BORDEN-

Speaker: prosecutor
Dialogue: Would you describe your occupation to the jury please, Mr.Cutter?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I'm an ingeneur. I design illusions and construct the apparatus necessary for perfoming them.

Speaker: prosecutor
Dialogue: And for how long had you been Mr.Angier's "ingeneur"?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Eight years. I was privvy to the secrets of his entire act.

Speaker: prosecutor
Dialogue: So, Mr.Cutter, was this water-filled tank beneath the stage part of Mr.Angier's illusion- the illusion billed as "THE REAL TRANSPORTED MAN"?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: No, sir. The tank had been used for the first trick, then taken offstage. Borden must have put it under the trap door after the interval.

Speaker: defender
Dialogue: How large was this tank?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: The sort of tank used for underwater escapes- four or five hundred gallons.

Speaker: defender
Dialogue: How do you think Mr.Borden was able to move the tank under the trap door without anyone noticing?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Ask him- he's the magician.

Speaker: defender
Dialogue: I ask again that this man explain the mechanics of Mr.Angier's illusion.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: If I reveal my magician's secrets here in open court, I'll be unemployable and the secrets will be worthless. The Real Transported Man is the most sought-after illusion in the business and I have te right to sell it on.

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: Mr.Cutter, I see your predicament but we are talking about a capital offence- Alfred Borden's life hangs in the balance.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: I'm going to have to ask you to turn out your pockets.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: My name is Owens- I'm a solicitor.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: How much?

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Lord Caldlow is interested in-

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Five thousand pounds.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Talk to Fallon, my ingenuer- the money's for him.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: I did. He offered to sell all of your tricks... except the most valuable one - The Transported Man.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I'd never forgive myself for selling my greatest trick. Borden signals the Wardens to come and unlock him.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Even for your daughter? Borden looks up. Owens moves closer, quietly assertive.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Fallon can take care of-

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Bernard Fallon? A man with a past even more obscure than your own? The court have already motioned to have the girl removed from his "care". No, the girl is to be an orphan. I've been to the work house... Owens looks around the prison yard. Shrugs.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Angier never learned my trick.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Really? When he returned from Colorado he mounted a version of the Transported Man that the papers said was better, even...

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: If you want Angier's secret you can dig him up and ask him for yourself.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: I want your secret, Mr.Borden...   Consider your daughter!

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: The whole town has electricity?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Quit a reception.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: You're our first guest of the season, Mr.Angier.  Your telegram didn't indicate how long you would be staying with us.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: As long as it takes.   I'll need a coach tomorrow to take me up the mountain.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: The peak is closed, sit. For scientific experimentation.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: That's why I'm here.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: You have to walk the reat, I'm afraid, sir.

Speaker: shotgun
Dialogue: I'm amazed at how many of you newspaper writers can't read mu sign.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Not the welcome I was expecting.

Speaker: shotgun
Dialogue: I know you. You're that magician-the Great Danton.  I'm Alley. I saw your show. IN London. Seven times- you guessed every object the audience had in their pockets. Angier leans on his cane and gently brushes off the dirt.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: I'm sorry about the fence. People keep interfering with our work.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I've come to see Tesla.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He built a machine for a- for a colleague of mine. A long time ago. Can you get me a meeting with him?  I've come a very long way.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Impossible, I'm afraid.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I've brought a lot of money. Beat.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Mr.Angier. I simply can't help you. Alley pulls the fence closed.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I'll be staying at the hotel. Indefinitely. Alley watches Angier walk away. He pulls something from his pocket.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: What am I holding? Angier doesn't look back.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Your watch.

Speaker: milton
Dialogue: Which of you brave souls is willing to bind this lovely young woman...

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Milton's squadering their goodwill or a bunch of tired second-hand tricks-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Old favourites, please.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: What about something fresh? He won't even try a bullet catch-

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: USE PLANTS-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He can't use plants for every trick.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: There'd be no seats left for the punters.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Fine- no bullet catch. But a real magician tries to invent something new, something other magicians scratch their heads over-

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: They sells it to them for a small fortune.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Actually, I do.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Care to sell it?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: No one else could do my trick.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I could.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You don't even know what it is.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Show it to me twice, I'll do it.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I admire your spirit, Mr.Angier. But if Borden here really has invented his masterpiece it might well be something only he can do.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: It might be something only he is prepared to do.  my illusions employer, Mr.Milton, is a skilled showman. But Borden's right- he won't get his hands dirty. You want to see what it takes to make real magic- go to the Tenley. There's a Chinaman there who's got what it takes.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Chung Ling Soo.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Tickets are pricey.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I know a lad on the door. You two watch his show- whoever tells me how he does his goldfish bowl trick gets the prize.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Which is?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Ten minutes onstage in front of my old friend, Mr.Ackerman.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Who's Ackerman?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: The most powerful theatrical agent in London.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I saw you drop the knot again, Borden.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I think I had my wrist turned-

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Some nights you just can't get it, can you? If that knot slips when Julia's on the hoist she'll break a leg.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: It's the wrong knot. A Langford double would hold tighter.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: The Langford double's not a wet knot it's too dangerous. The ropes could swell and she'd never slip it-

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I can slip a Lanford underwater.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: We've been practiced it-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He said no.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: No more mistakes.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Where's he from?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Where are you from?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He works for another magician? Aren't you worried he'll steal your tricks?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: He doesn't deal in methods.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: How do you know?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I don't know if I trust him.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: He's a natural magician. Of course you can't trust him.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I think he's alright. Angier turns to Julia. Smiles.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You think everyone's alright.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Even you. Julia kisses Angier. Cutter rises.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: And Mr.Angier...?  Learn your aight lines- if I can see you sneaking a peck on your wife's ankle from the wings, the blokes on each end of rows 3 and 4 can, too.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Look- he's all right. He's fine.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Sharp lad, your son.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You're the lucky one tonight. Borden walks to a wall of DOZENS of bird cages -- each one with an identical canary. He puts the bird into its cage and returns to the cart props. He taps on the top of the TABLE- a panel POPS open, revealing the FLATTENDED BIRD CAGE. Borden insefts a ROD into the bird cage and PRIES it apart. A TRICKLE of BLOOD emerges, dripping into a bucket below. Borden SLAPS the cage. And the FLATTENED CARCASS of the ORIGINAL BIRD slides out and SPLASHES into the bucket.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Are you watching closely? Borden reaches to the Boy's ear. Casually produces a coin. The Boy marvels as he takes the coin then looks at Borden.

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: It's got two heads. Sarah smiles. Borden crouches to address the Boy, grave.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Never. Show. Anyone.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: He lives with Mum.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: And you?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Enough to keep me out?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I think so. Wil I see you again?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You're wrong. It can't be.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: It is. He carries the bowl between his knees for the entire performance.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: but look at the man!

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: This is the trick. This is why no one detectes his method.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I can barely lift this thing and it's not even filled with water. Or fish. He must be strong as an ox.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: He's been preteding to be an cripple for years?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Any time he's in public. Any time he goes out. It's unthinkable.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: You're pretending to be someone else.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I don't think changing your name compares.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Not just your name- who you are, where you're from...

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I promised my family I wouldn't embarrass them with my theatrical endeavors. Angier cuddles up to Julia.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I came up with a name for you... "The Great Danton"   You don't like it? It's sophisticated.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It's French.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Alfred?!

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: We have our routine for Ackerman!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: We haven't had the pleasure.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Mr.Fallon is my ingeneur-

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Where did yo get all of-

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Begged, borrowed and don't ask. Mr.Fallon's an enterprising soul.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I need talk to you.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: We'll start making money once we have our audience-

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: And until then? What I earn is barely enough for us.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I'll give him half of my food.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: You're already going to be sharing it with someone else.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You're...?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Having a baby.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: The trick to wake up Ackerman at the end of my audition.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Your great trick? The "masterpiece that will make our fortunes"?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: No. The world isn't ready for that one, yet. Borden moves to the bureau and starts LOADING the gun. Pouring in SHOT, then WADDING...

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I'm not letting you get shot. Borden RAMS the bullet and charge down then removes the RAMROD and hands the pistol to Sarah.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: It's perfectly safe. Shoot me. Sarah looks at Borden then down at the pistol. She aims at Borden. Then sims off, at a mirror beside him. BANG. Borden's hand SNAPS out to "catch" the bullet. The mirror is intact. Borden looks at Sarah, grave, as he reveals the bullet in his hand.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Show me.  Then you're not doing it. I can't raise a child on my own, Alfred. Borden looks at her. Takes the bullet from her and places it on the bureau.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: The bullet goes in the gun. Then comes the ramrod. He takes the RAMROD and PUSHES it down onto the bullet, which disappears.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Once you know it's so obvious.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Yes, well, people still get killed perfoming it.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Sme smart-arse drops something down the barrel.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Such as?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: A penny, or a button. Or, of course, a bullet.  But don't fret-

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Say it again.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I love you.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Nope. Not today.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: It's alright. I like being able to tell the difference- it makes the days it is true mean something.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Bloody fool.

Speaker: policeman
Dialogue: It's all laid out down the end, you honour.

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: What's in there?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Angier's machine.

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: You built this, Mr.Cutter?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: A man who can actually do the things a magician pretends to...

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: They've benn sold to a Lord Caldlo. An avid collector, apparently very interested in the case.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Don't let him take this.

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: Why ever not?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: It's dangerous.

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: I'm sure beneath its bells and whistles it's get some simple and disappointing trick.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: The most disappointing of all- it has no trick. It's real.

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: This is the tank Angier drowned in?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: This lets the performer's hands reach the trick padlock...

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: A standard magical apparatus for escapes?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: With one important difference...

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: What a way to kill someone. Why in God's name go to such lengths?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: These are magicians, you honour. Showmen. Men who live by dressing up plain and sometimes brutal truths to amaze. To shock.

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: Even without and audience?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: There was and audience.  See, the water tank had a particular signinficance for the two men...

Speaker: milton
Dialogue: Which of you brave souls is willing bind this lovely young woman?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: How can be not know?!

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: "How can be not know?!"   Because, Angier, life is complicated, people are complicated, knots are  COMPLICATED-

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: Alfred Borden, you have been found guilty of the murder of Robert Angier. You will, in one month's time, be hanged by the neck until dead. May the Lord have mercy on your soul.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: They took her away?   To the workhouse?

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Tesla sends me down here during the storms. Perfect excuse to come shere a drink with the Great Danton.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Why are you here?

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: The lightning lives here. And noit much else- our work is secret.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: My profession also deals in secrets.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Which is?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: We magicians have a circle of trust.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: You have a circle of trust with someone whose dairy you stole?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Maybe I bought it.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Magicians sell their secrets?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It's how we pay for our retirements and how greats tricks outlive us.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: You're hoping to find a great secretin there?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I've already found it. That's why I'm here.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Why would you want the same thing?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Call it a professional rivalry.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Tesla has built unusual machines for unusual people, but he would never talk about it.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I understand discretion. I just want the machine.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Finish your drink. You'll have a special appreciation for our work.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I thought it was a secret.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: You're a magician. Who's going to believe you?

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: We do our tests when the townspeople are asleep- Mr.Tesla doesn't want to scare anyone.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Where are the wires?

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Exactly.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Where's the generator?

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: You saw it last week.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: But that must be ten miles from here.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Fifteen. And I have to ride all of them before I get to bed.  I'll send word for you in a few days, Mr.Angier.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Get out your gun, Professor!

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: A volunteer.

Speaker: moustache
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Never thought I'd find an answer at the bottom of a pint glass.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Hasn't stopped you looking.   I heard about a booking. Nice little theatre. Good up-and-coming magician.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: You.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You got me a booking? Why?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Because I want to keep working...  And who's going to hire the ingeneur who killed Julia McCullough in front of a sellout crowd at the Orpheum?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Someone who know that it wasn't your fault. Someone who knows Alfred Borden and his repertoire of exotic knots.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Heard he had a spot of bad luck doing a bullet catch South of the river.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: To die like that. Locked in water... lungs screaming...   What did she go through, Cutter?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I knew an old sailor. Told me about a time he got pulled over the side tangled in the sheets... they dragged him out, but it was five minutes before he coughed...

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Which knot did Borden tie that night?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: He wouldn't say.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Wouldn't say?!

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: It was as if... as if he didn't know.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: We'll have to whitewash the windows to cofound the more curious members of your audience...   But this should do.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: We should see about an assistant.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I've made arrangements. Have you settled on a name?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Yes, I have. The Great Danton.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Hmm. Bit old-fashioned? Angier smiles gently at Cutter.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: No. It's sophisticated.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: What's so hard about this? Cutter leans into the cabinet and pops up a TRICK PANEl in the floor, revealing a tiny chamber.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: In here, Miss Wenscombe. No point meeting Mr.Angier unless you fit. Olivia shrugs and hands Cutter her hat, then her thick skirts, and folds herself into the bottom of the box.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I don't understand, Alfred. How can it be bleeding again?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: We can' afford the doctor back! A BABY STARTS CRYING in the bedroom. Sarah glares at Borden.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: You've woken her.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I just need this to heal so I can het back to work.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Alfred, you have to face things. What tricks could you peform with this kind of injury?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Some of the card pulls, prop tricks...  And the trick I've been telling you about. The trick they'll remember me for.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: The bird cage can't be our climax- everybody knows it.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Not like this, they don't.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: And I don't want to kill doves.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: You're a magician, not a wizard- you have to get your hands dirty to achieve the impossible.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You sound like him.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Put your hands on the sides...

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I need a volunteer.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Hang on, hang on...

Speaker: merrit
Dialogue: You'd beat not be intending to hut this animal, Mr.Angier.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Of course not.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: ...THREE!

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: And the best part...

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Thought you said I had to get my hands dirty.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Someday, perhaps you will. I needed to know that you can.

Speaker: merrit
Dialogue: Very nice. Very nice indeed.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I haven't had a chance to compliment you on your beautiful theatre yet, Mr.Merrit.

Speaker: merrit
Dialogue: A lot more beautiful when it's full, Mr.Angier.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Don't worry.

Speaker: merrit
Dialogue: You all say that. Why sould I worry? If your tricks don't get 'em in, someone else's will. Maybe someone willing to do a bullet catch or a water scape.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: cheap thrills, Mr.Merrit. People hoping for an accident- and quite likely to see one, too. What would that do for your business?

Speaker: merrit
Dialogue: You've got a week.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You sir, in the hat. Could you show us your handkerchief?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: This isn't mine.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Perhaps you'd be so good as to return it to the other man. He has yours.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: I'm so nervous- I'm sorry, I'm making mistakes. Cutter quickly REMOVES Angier's coat...

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: The audience doesn't seem to be responding much, Cutter. Cutter puts he LEATHER HARNESS over Angier's arms...

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: This is a grand theatre with a sophisticated audience- They've seen most of these tricks before. But not this next one. You'll see. Cutter checks the SPRINGS of the harness and replaces Angier's coat. He spots a STAGEHAND poking his head around the flies.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Wish us luc, Cutter.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You've seen this one before?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Well, I'll make it a little harder, shall I?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I should've spotted him.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: You had a lot of plates spinning.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Don't suppose they'll let us do this one again.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: So what's the climax of our show?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Mr.Merrit, we have a week's engagment-

Speaker: merrit
Dialogue: To perform magic- not butcher birds and break my costomer's fingers! Clear out, anything here in the morning gets burned.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Mr.Merrit-

Speaker: merrit
Dialogue: It's done, John. I've hired a comedian. You know I hate comedians, which should indicate the may I felel about your friend's future as a stage magician.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: There are plenty of good theatres... if we can come up with another trick and change the name of the act-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: The name stays.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Right. Well, the new trick will have to be irresistible, then. I've a couple of methods to try out, but we'll need a fresh angle on the presentation.

Speaker: ticket hawker
Dialogue: Would you like to know the future, sir? The man who kill change the world is speaking right now. Continents divided no more. Free, clean power. The mysteries of the world solved.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: With a system like this I could have the entire city electrified whitin two years.

Speaker: audience member
Dialogue: Fraud.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I love you.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: See? Today, it's true.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Guard! Guard!!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: What do want, Professor?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Paper and pencil. Please.

Speaker: sullen
Dialogue: Let me see?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Only if I teach you how to read.

Speaker: sullen
Dialogue: Just stupid tricks, right? Haven't helped you get out of here-   Have they? Or can't you open real locks, Professor?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Perhaps I'm just biding my time. Perhaps one day I'll just hold up my

Speaker: sullen
Dialogue: How'd you get so famous, then? Borden STANDS.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Magic. Borden TURNS, NO LONGER CHAINED. Sullen JUMPS to his feet to follow, but HIS ANKLE IS CHAINED TO THE TABLE. The other PRISONERS are LAUGHING and CHEERING.

Speaker: sullen
Dialogue: Oi, Borden, get back here! Sullen FUMBLES with his keys as Borden takes a BOW. Another warder CRACKS Borden over the head with a TRUNCHEON. Sullen, now free, KICKS Borden in the ribs.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: I don't really.... have anywhere to go. Angier slips the newspaper from the table.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You've been sleeping here?

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Cutter said it would be okay till we get another booking.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Researching. Part of a magician's job is to watch his competition, to see what illusions they're-

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: You're going to do something to that man, aren't you? Olivia moves closer. Angier is quiet.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Even? My wife for a couple of his fingers? He has a child now. And he's perfoming again.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Us. Olivia moves towards him.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I need a volunteer. Angier takes a few steps towards the stage. Borden produces a RUBBER BALL. he TOSSES the ball to Angier.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: What happened, Robert?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He had a new trick.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Was it good?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Did they applaud when you saw it?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Not very enthusiastically.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: The trick is too good -- too simple- the audience harly knows what they've seen.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He's a dreadful magician.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: He's a wonderfull magician- he's a dreadful showman. He doesn't know how to dress it up, how to sell the trick.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: How does he do it?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: He uses a double.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: You think that because you don't know the method. It's a double who comes out at the end. It's the only way.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I've seen his perfom ir three times now, Mr. Cutter- the Prestige is the

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: The same man comes out of the second cabinet. I promise you.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: It is the same man. They both turn to look at Olivia.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He doesn't know how to sell his trick to an audience. But I do.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: It would give us our climax.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: The man stole my life. I'm going to steal his trick.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: We'll have to find someone who can look like you on a stage.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He doesn't use a double-

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Ang the only way I know is to find you a bloody good double.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Take a good look- let's get out there and find me.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: It's perfectly safe.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: So this is the Great Danton.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I saw a lecture you gave in London, several years ago. I'm flattered you agreed to see me. Tesla keeps hold as Angier's hand.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: Our bodies, Mr. Angier, are quite capable of conducting, and indeed, producing energy.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: Alley has explained that you require a very interesting device.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I need something impossible.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: You're familiar with a phrase 'Man's reach exceeds his grasp'?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: If people thought the things I did on stage were real, they wouldn't clap- they'd scream. Think of saving a woman in half. Tesla nods. Considering.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: Mr.Angier, the cost of such a machine-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Price is not an object.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: Perhaps not. But have you considered the cost?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I'm noit sure I follow.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: I can make your machine, Mr. Angier. But I can also give you some advice...

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Have your obsessions done you no good?

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: At first. But I've followed them too long- I am their slave. Their whipping boy. And one day they may choose to destroy me. Angier looks into Tesla's eyes.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: if you understand an obsession then you know you won't change my mind.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Will you build it?

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: I have already begun to build it, Mr. Angier. I hope you enjoy the mountain air. This will take time. Tesla disappears into the lab.

Speaker: root
Dialogue: A pleasure to meet you fine gentlemen.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He's out of his mind.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: He's an out-of-work actor- of course he's out of his mind.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: He's perfect. A little work, mind you, but when I'm done with him he could be your brother.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I don't need him to be my brother. I need him to be me.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Would you like to see a magic trick?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: What is this for?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You caught me in the wrong mood.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: But you want through all the-

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Sarah, I'm allowed to change my mind, aren't I? The act is taking off, maybe soon I'll get us into a bigger theatre. Things will work.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: You walk through this one- then...?

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Oof. Couldn't you find a softer one?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It's not for sleeping on.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: And Root goes up through there?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It has to be. Borden's trick is getting noticed. The place was packed today.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: You went and saw his show again?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: All I have to do is keep myself stinking drunk all the time and no one will be able to tell the difference.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: A little faith, sir. Could you favor us with a perfomance. Mr. Root?

Speaker: root
Dialogue: You would drink, too, if you know the world half so well as I do.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: You can go back to being yourself. Root. For free.. Root looks challengingly at both men.

Speaker: root
Dialogue: I'd rather be him, for now. I find it amusing. Root WAVES his hands across his chest, in the same manner that Angier does onstage. He produces a bottle of Gin from thin air, and takes a long swallow and jumps down to Olivia.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Root has to keep a low profile-- anyone sees him the game's up.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Have you thought about what we should call the trick?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: No point being coy. Borden calls his trick 'The Transported Man'? Cutter nods.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, much of what you've seen tonight can be termed illusions. Entertaining trifles of the sort you may have seen other magicians perform.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: The manager said he's never seen a reaction like it. Angier smiles, rueful.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: At least he got to see it. I spent the ovation hidden under the stage. No one cares about the man who disappears, the man who goes into the box. They care about the man who comes out the other side.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: I care about the man in the box. Angier turns to Olivia, raises his glass.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Root, you bloody fool, get that costume and makeup off right now, anyone could walk in here!

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I suppose I should get more rest.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Life is not full of these moments, Robbie.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: The trick isn't good enough.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Didn't you see the audience?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Well, they loved it.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It's not as good as his trick.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Borden's trick is nothing compared to ours. He doesn't have any style-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He doesn't have to spend the finale hiding under the stage.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: So that I can do it better. Angier turns to her. Looks her in the eye.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Work for him? Are you joking

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You'll be my spy.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It's how we advance. Angier moves to Olivia, placing his hands on her shoulders.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Exactly why he'll want to hire you. He'll want my secrets.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Why would he trust me? Angier thinks for a second. Then smiles.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Because you're going to tell him the truth.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: You must be curious to see what so much money had bought you, Mr. Angier.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: You might want to stand back.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: No, no. It will be fine. Mr. Alley, please proceed.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I don't understand-

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Perhaps it would be best if you left us to it. We'll see you next week?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: We make do.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: My name is Olivia Wenscombe.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I know who you are. Are you here to steal the rest of my show? Olivia sees one of the theatrical notices that litter the shop: "THE GREAT DANTON BREAKS RECORD WITH HIS ASTONISHING

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: No. I'm here to give your show what is missing.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: And what might that be?

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Me.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: I've left Angier. I want a job. Borden sits there.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Why on earth shouldn't I trust you? The mistress of my enemy.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Mr.Borden-

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Alfred.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Alfred. I'm going to tell you the truth.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Ah. The truth. A slippery notion in our life of work, Miss Wenscombe.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: I'm here because he sent me here. He wants me to come and work for you and steal your secret.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: What does he need my secret for? His trick is top notch. The Great Danton vanishes and isntantly reappears on the other side of the stage -- mute, overweight, and, unless I'm mistaken, rather drunk.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: No. It's killing him. he's obsessed with discovering your method. He thinks of nothing else, and takes no pleasure in our sucess. I've had enough. There's no future with him. He sent me here to steal your secrets, but I've actually come to offer you his.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: He has no secrets from me.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Best be getting changed for the martinee, sir. - Angier nods. Cutter REALIZES.

Speaker: root
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: No?! Root looks at Cutter with genuine malice.

Speaker: root
Dialogue: We need to have a chat, Mr.Cutter.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: We have a problem, Cutter. He holds up the paper, folded to an advertisement:

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: We have a bigger problem. Root.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Don't tell me he fell over again.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Worse. He realized he can make demands.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He's blackmailing us?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: In a word, yes. I'm surprised, to be honest- it usually takes them a lot longer to figure it out.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: How much does he want?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: It makes no difference- we have to stop doing the trick.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Look at yesterday's. And last week's, where they called you "London's premiere stage performer", not "magician" mind. Performer. Of any kind.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: What's the point?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: My point, Robert, is that you've climbed too high to get away with any kind of professional embarrassament. We're not doing any tricks we can't control. Angier considers this. Nods. Thinking.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Pay him whatever he wants, for now. We keep doing the trick till Borden opens, then we'll phase it out.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Get it down!

Speaker: root
Dialogue: To what do I owe the pleasure of this rather welcome pint of ale?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You are the Great Danton, aren't you?

Speaker: root
Dialogue: Of course I am. But don't advertise it- I'll be mobbed with fans.  And who might you be?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Just a humble admirer. And fellow practitioner.

Speaker: root
Dialogue: Ah, very good. Root DOWNS the rest of his new pint, placing the empty glass in front of Borden with an emphatic THUNK.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Another?

Speaker: root
Dialogue: If you insist. I'm not perfoming tonight. Well, only one show, and, to be frank, my people pretty much run things these days.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You could probably do it blindfolded.

Speaker: root
Dialogue: Bloody good idea.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Have it.

Speaker: root
Dialogue: Thanks. A new pint arrives. Root sips.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Actually, there's something I might warn you about.

Speaker: root
Dialogue: Oh?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Well, it's your Transported Man illusion. Now, I'm noit claiming to know your method... but I had a similar trick in my act- and I used... (looks around,

Speaker: root
Dialogue: Oh, I see, very good.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: At first. Then it went bad. You se, I hadn't counted on the fact that once I incorporated this bloke into my act, he had complete power over me.

Speaker: root
Dialogue: Complete power, you say?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You must be very careful about giving someone that power over you.

Speaker: root
Dialogue: Thanks for the warning.  INT. STAGE, EMPIRE THEATRE -- EVENING

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: ...some of you may be familiar with this technique, but for those of you who aren't, do not be alarmed, what you are about to see is considered safe...

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Great Danton, I must apologize! I simply had too much magic for my stage at the Pantages!

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I don't see how Borden found him- I had him under wraps, I was careful.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Well, he did.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Sit, do you think it might be her? Olivia?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: No. I don't.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Shall we cut him down?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: He's the Great Danton. Let him cut himself down.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You weren't expecting me?

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: I was expecting you sooner, Robbie. Your message said "afternoon".

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Well, it takes a bit for me to get around these days...

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: What do you mean? You sent me to-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I sent you to steal his secret- not to improve his act-

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: That's my job-!

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Or to fall in love with him!

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: You abandoned me to him!

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Yes? Then how does he do it?!

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Cutter was right- it's a double.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Of course Borden said that-

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: He didn't say anything- he'd never say. I've seen things- make-up, glasses, wigs. We don't use any of it for the show, but I've found it hidden backstage.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It's misdirection- he leaves those things lying around to make you think he's using a double.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: All the time? He doesn't know when  I'M LOOKING-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: All the time, Olivia- that's who he is, that's what it takes- he lives his act, don't you see?!   And just because you're sleeping with him doesn't mean he trusts you.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: You thing you can see everything, don't you?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You stole it?

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: I borrowed it for tonight. I thought you'd be able to translate some of it, but now I realize-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I can't.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: You can't.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Olivia, no one could-   It's a cypher- with a transposition that probably shifts every day of the diary. Even with the keyword it would take months to decode...

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: And without the keyword?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Perhaps never. We'll see.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: No, we won't- if I don't get that back tomorrow morning, he'll know I took it.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You can'r possibly think I'd let this go? This is his diary, Olivia. All of his secrets are right here, in my hands.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Don't do this do me, Robert!

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Leave him.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: He knows where I live!

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I need to know his method.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: It won't get your wife back, Robert.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I don't care about my wife- I care about his secret!

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: He'll know it was you-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Yes, me, not you. Understand?

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Robert? I have fallen in love with him. Angier looks at her, sympathetic.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Then I know how hard this had been hard for you.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Notebook. Fallon nods. Borden sighs. Weary.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I'm walking tonight, gentlemen. Fallon looks concerned.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I'll live.   You save me the trouble to making you an air hole!

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I'm impressed.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Why's that?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You're finally getting your hands dirty. This is what a good trick costs, Angier. Risk. Sacrifice.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: The sacrifice, I'm afraid, is all going to be yours. Unless you give me what I want.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Which is?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Your secret.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: My secret?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Your method for the Transported Man. Fallon wouldn't tell me. In fact, he doesn't talk at all.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You have my notebook.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Useless without the keyword.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: The keyword is the method.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: How fast can you gid?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: How's the arm?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Still attached. Did you get your answer?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Our answer, Cutter. I haven't looked yet, I wanted you to share this.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I already know how he does it, Robert. The same way he always has, the same way we do. You just want it to be something more.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Well, let's find out, shall we?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: What does it mean?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It means, Cutter, that we have a journey ahead of us. To America.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Robert, listen to me.  Obssession is a young man's game, I can't follow you any farther in this.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Then the rest is up to me.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I didn't know we'd be joined for dinner.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Absolutely. We're celebrating.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Miss Wenscombe. Mr.Fallon.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Champagne. Your finest

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: What are we celebrating, dear?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Well, we've hit upon a new trick, haven't we, Fallon?

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: What trick, Freddy?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Yes, "Freddy". What trick?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I'm going to bury myself alive. Every night. Then someone's going to come along and dig me up! OTHER DINERS are glancing over. The waiter uncorks the bottle with a muffled POP and pours champagne into Borden's glass.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I'm not sure my husband needs-

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Who are you to tell me what?!

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: PERHAPS-

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Perhaps, Mr.Fallon, you might escort Miss Wenscombe home. My husband's being a bore. I see no reason for the two of you to suffer as well.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Good-night, Mrs.Borden. Good-night, Freddy.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: "Freddy"?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: It's my name.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Not at home.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I'm not always at home.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Alfred, why are you being like this?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Sarah, I had a terrible ordeal today. I thought I'd lost something very precious to me.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Secrets are my life, Sarah. Our life.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: When you're like this, Alfred, I'm not seeing the real you. You're treating me like your audience. Performing. I can't live with that.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I thought I had the place to myself.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Unexpected guests.  Not very polite. A lot of questions. At first I thought they might work for the government.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: No?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Worse. They work for Thomas Edison.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: No. It's killing him. He's obssessed with discovering your method. he thinks of nothing else, and takes no pleasure in our success. I've had enough. There is no future with him. He sent me here to steal your secrets, but I've actually come to offer you his.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: He has no secrets from me.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: No. This is what he told me to tell you. Beat.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I can spot Angier's methods from the back of the theatre. What could you possibly have to offer me? Olivia smiles, moves to Borden, reaching for his gloved hand. Borden flinches, surprised.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: You may know he does his tricks... but you can't understand why no one can see that yours are better. She tenderly PEELS OFF his padded glove revealing his mutiladed hand.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Then let people know. You can be so much more then he is. I can show you how. Borden looks into her eyes.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Robbie's blinded by his jealosy. He'd do anything for you secret. Sending me away was the least of it. Borden considers this.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: TESLA!    TESLA!!

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I've veen played for a fool!

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Who by?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Tesla never made a machine like the one I asked for.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: We never said he had.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You let me believe that he had, Alley!

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: In the hotel. I've every mind to bring them up here myself-

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: That would be unwise, Mr.Angier.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Sir, my cat?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Then why isn't the machine working?

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: Because exact science, Mr.Angier, is not an exact science. The machine simply does not operate as expected. It needs continued examination.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Where did my top hat go?

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: Nowhere.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: Which is why we need to rey a different material. It may provoke a different result. Tesla opens the cage and points the open end at Alley.

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: You are responsible for whatever happens to this animal, Doctor. Alley pulls himself out of the pit, and Tesla CHARGES the generator. The cat stares up at the machine around it and HISSES. Without ceremony, Tesla FIRES the machine. As before, large BOLTS spew from the head of the machine, down towards the unseen cat. The machine build to a DEAFENING ROAR, then sputters out. Silence. The three men begin edging towards the pit. Suddenly, a terrifying SCREECH. The cat is still there, still tied to the hook. Alley breathes a sigh of relief and starts to free the car. Tesla looks frustated. Suddenly, the cat bursts free of Alley and ROCJETS through the open side door of the lab.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I'll go. Angier limps after the cat.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Here, kitty, kitty.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: So the machine was working?

Speaker: alley
Dialogue: I never bothered to check the calibration. The hat never moved.

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: These things never quite work as you expect them to, Mr. Angier. That's one of the principal beauties of science.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Which one is mine?

Speaker: tesla
Dialogue: They are all your hat, Mr. Angier. Tesla smiles at him.

Speaker: jess
Dialogue: Are we going to the zoo this afternoon, daddy?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Daddy's got some business this afternoon.

Speaker: jess
Dialogue: But you promised.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Did I? Jess nods at him, solemly.

Speaker: jess
Dialogue: That's you, daddy? Borden picks up the girl off of his lap and stands.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Daddy has some errands to run. I'll be back before you know it, so get ready.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: We each have our vices. Borden moves to her, gentle concern in his eyes.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Sarah. Whatever you may think, your only competitions for my affections is my little girl. I love you. I will always love you, and you alone. She looks into his eyes. Fascinated.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: You mean it today.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Absolutely.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: That makes it so much harder when you don't. She turns from him. Borden watches her sadly. Leaves.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: More shopping. She doesn't like the smell of money, doesn't she? Fallon looks away. Borden tears up the paper.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: What is it. Freddy?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Please don't call me that. It's nothing, just... sometimes things seem... wrong.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Freddy, I've told you before. When you're with me, you're with me. Leave your family at home where they belong.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I'm trying, Olivia. Please.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: I'll get dressed.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You trust me?  Then trust Fallon- he protects the things I care about.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: We're sorry to see you go, Mr. Angier.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: What box?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: We never use these rooms in the off - season. It's a shame.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Yes, you, Borden. Sitting there, in your cell, reading my diary. Awaiting your death. For my murder.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Lord Caldlow was happy to hear that you'd reconsidered his offer.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Angier's journal, the "gesture of good faith"? It's a fake.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: I assure you it's not.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: It has to be- it refers to events that happened after his death.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Clever predictions, I'm sure. The provenance of the journal is clear and under no doubt. It's written in Angier own hand, of which we have numerous examples.  What makes you think it's a fake?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: It doesn't matter.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Including the Transported Man? Lord Caldlow will be very pleased.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: No he won't. They're not complete- you only have the Pledge and Turn for each.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Without the Prestige for each trick these are wothless.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You'll get the rest after you bring my daughter here.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Deny it all you want- I know!  INT. LIVING ROOM, BORDEN'S HOUSE -- CONTINUOUS

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Sarah, it's not true! I've told you Olivia means nothing to me!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I'll go yo her! I know what you really are, Alfred!

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Sarah. You can't do that.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I can't live like this!

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Not today. Sarah takes this in. Borden watches, helpless.

Speaker: who's there
Dialogue: Cutter turns. A STAGEHAND. His eyes are solid white. The man is clearly BLIND.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I- I'm looking for an old friend-

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: You came back.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It's a good to see you, John. Cutter sizes Angier up. Looks around the theatre.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Good rehearsal space. Blind stagehands. I like it-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I need your help, John. My last show. A limited engagement.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Your last show?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: A wise man once told me that obsession was a young man's game. I'm almost done. One thing left...  The real Transported Man.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: You want to design a show around it?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: i don't want you backstage, I need you front of house, managing.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: What sort of booking are you after?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: The sort that Borden can't ignore. Cutter looks at Angier. Nods.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: This is the address, sir.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Mr.Ackerman. It's an honor to see you again, sir.

Speaker: ackerman
Dialogue: When you said you only wanted to show me one trick it piqued my interest.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: It's a very special trick. Mr.Ackerman.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Pleased to meet you, Mr. Ackerman.

Speaker: ackerman
Dialogue: Likewise, I'm sure. Let's get on, shall we?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Turn it on, please.

Speaker: ackerman
Dialogue: Very pretty.

Speaker: ackerman
Dialogue: EXACTLY-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Are you interested in helping us?

Speaker: ackerman
Dialogue: Yes. But you'll have to dress it up a little. Disguise it. Give them enough reason to doubt it.

Speaker: ackerman
Dialogue: I have an act for your venue.

Speaker: ackerman
Dialogue: Get rid of them. This is a magical act. An excellent one. I believe you booked his first engagement several years ago. The Great Danton.

Speaker: merrit
Dialogue: You really want me to- Ackerman stands.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: You haven't spopken about her, Freddy. Not once.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Don't be cruel.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Why would I talk about her to you?

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: Because she was part of your life and now she's gone.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I never loved Sarah.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: You married her, had a child with  HER-

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Part of me loved her. But part of me didn't. The part that found you. The part that's sitting here now. I love you. That is the truth that matters.

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: You could be sitting in some other restaurant talking to some other woman about me that way. It's unhuman to be so cold.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: He's back?

Speaker: olivia
Dialogue: After two years. And he has a new trick. They're saying it's the best that London's ever seen.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, my first trick of the evening is one that involves considerable risk.  Anyone in the audience who would be irrevocable damaged by seeing a man drown should leave now, for when I tell you that the young lady who taught performing it, you will understand the seriousness of the danger involved.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: In my travels I have seen the future, and it is a strange future indeed. The world is on the brink of new and terrifying possibilities. The audience RECOILS in terror as the MACHINE is STARTED and BOLTS fly from it. SMOKE drift over the audience. Borden inches forward in his seat. Angier stands in front of the machine, silhouetted by the FRENZY of electricity behind him. He TOSSES his cane to his assistant and steps into the machine. The audience SCREAMS as large bolts BLAST from the machine and wrap themselves around ANGIER'S ARMS and legs. Borden is watching very carefully. Angier is almost impossible to see as the machine builds to a climax, but, just before it does; Borden catches a glimpse of ANGIER'S

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Why only 100 performances? Do his methods dictate it, or is it simply a publicity move? Borden walks back and stares at the sketch.

Speaker: blind stagehand
Dialogue: WHO'S THERE!

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: It's Cutter.

Speaker: blind stagehand
Dialogue: What do you want?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I'm looking for Angier.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You found him.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: What are they doing?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Disposing of the Prestige materials.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: What's down there?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Do you really want to know? Cutter considers Angier's grave tone.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Perhaps not. Cutter leaves by the stage door.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: They do this every night. After each performance? Fallon nods. Borden gets to his feet with a sigh. Turns to a POSTER on the wall- "The Great Danton Perform THE REAL

Speaker: stagehand
Dialogue: Where'd you think you're going?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I'm part of the act, you fool!

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Who was that?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: What did you do?

Speaker: judge
Dialogue: You will, in one month's time, be hanged by the neck until dead. May the Lord have mercy on your soul.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Mr.Cutter?   Owens.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Thank you for coming, Mr.Owens. It's fallen to me to dispose of Mr.Angier's equipment. Looking at the manifest, it's cleat that Lord Caldlow has purchased the bulk of the items.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Mr.Cutter, if you needed to know where to deliver the items you surely could have just-

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: It's not just that, Mr.Owens. There is a particular item  This time, in fact, that I wish to... well, that is to say, I want to-

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: You wnat to buy it instead.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I suppose so, yes.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: This is the machine?   I'm afraid Lord Caldlow was adamant about procuring this particular item.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Perhaps if I dould talk to Lord Caldlow in person.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Out of the question, I'm afraid.

Speaker: sullen
Dialogue: Still here, Borden?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: For now.

Speaker: sullen
Dialogue: Got a visitor. Lord Caldlow. With a little girl.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Jess, how are you?

Speaker: jess
Dialogue: Can I come in there, Daddy?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Everything's going to be okay. It is only then that he notices the HAND ON HER SHOULDER. He rises to come face-to-face with Lord Caldlow-

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: I saw you die. Angier just SMILES.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: They flatter you with all those chains, Alfred. Don't they know you can't escape without your little rubber ball? Borden says nothing.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You were always afraid to get your hands dirty... (looks down at his

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: No. Not anymore. And I win. Because no one cares about the man in the box, the man who disappears.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You win. But don't take my little girl... Angier looks at Borden. Bitter

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I know how hard it is to have someone so precious taken away, don't I

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Wait. Don't you want this? You paid for it.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Your secret.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Angier! Let me say good-bye. Please.

Speaker: jess
Dialogue: When are you taking me home, Daddy?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Soon. I promise. Soon.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: For God's sake, Borden.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Daddy's coming, I promise. I promise.  HERE-

Speaker: housekeeper
Dialogue: Come here, love.   Sir, there's gentleman waiting.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Dead God.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Hello, Cutter.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: You're alive.   How?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I learned an American accent from-

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: How are you alive, Robert?! I saw you on the slab, for God's sake.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: I magician never reveals his secrets.

Speaker: housekeeper
Dialogue: Go on, child.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Good night, Jess.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Who's the girl?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: She needs looking after-

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: She needs her father, but you're letting him hang. And I helped you.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You don't have to. I'm going to make sure the machine. is never used again.   A good magician never repeats his tricks.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Then, Lord Caldlow, where would like me to deliver it?

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: My theatre. It belongs with the Prestige materials.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I once told you about the sailor who described drowing to me...

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I was lying. He said it was agony.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: We go alone now- both of us. Only I don't have as far to go as you.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Thank-you gents.

Speaker: workman
Dialogue: Where do you want it?

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: Don't worry. Someone's coming to help. The workmen levae. Cutter looks at the crate. Angier emerges from the darkness.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I'm bringing this over after we're done.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Cautions as ever, Cutter. No one's going to use the place. I own it.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: No room left- you couldn't have acommodated 100 performances.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It's a good thing I retired early then. Angier puts the lattern and his cane on the lif of the crate and the two men heft ir off the platform.

Speaker: cutter
Dialogue: I'll go mix the cement. Cutter looks at Angier, cold.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Cutter, I tried not to involve you. Cutter looks at Angier. Nods. Then disappears into darkness.

Speaker: warden
Dialogue: Alfred borden, on this day, in the name of the King and the high court of England, you will meet your end. Do you have anything to say for yourself. Borden saus nothing. The Warden gestures to the HANGMAn who begins to PULL the lever.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: You were Fallon. The whole time... Fallon/Borden's face disappears as Cutter seals his coffin.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: We were both Fallon. And we were both Borden.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Were you the one who went into the  BOX-

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Cutter knew. But I told him it was too simple. Too easy.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: Simple, maybe. But not easy.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: What about Olivia? And your wife?

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: We each loved one of them. We each had half a full life. Enough for us, but not for them. Borden puts the ball in his pocket. Tears in his eyes.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: It takes nothing to steal someone else's work.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It takes everything.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: It didn't work.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Do you want to see what it cost me? You didn't see where you are, did you? Let me show you.

Speaker: borden
Dialogue: You went halfway around the world. You spent a fortune. You did terrible things... and all of it for nothing.

Speaker: angier
Dialogue: Nothing? You never understood, id you? Why we did this?   You really don't know?
